org.jacktheclipper.frontend.service

Class OuService

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jacktheclipper.frontend.service.OuService

  • @Service
public class OuService
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles all request to the backend which concern organizational units. This includes e. g. requesting an organizational unit's settings or getting a list of all existing organizational units.

    • Method Detail

      • getOrganizationalUnits

        public java.util.List<OrganizationalUnit> getOrganizationalUnits(java.util.UUID userId)
                                                          throws BackendException
        Returns a list of all currently existing OrganizationalUnits. This does not separate between top level organizational units (like BMW, Audi, etc.) and lower level organizational units (like BMW/Marketing, Audi/HR, etc.). This method calls getOrganizationalUnits(UUID, boolean) with the boolean being set to false.
        Parameters:
        userId - The user requesting the OrganizationalUnits
        Returns:
        A list of all currently existing organizational units. The entries might be nested in OrganizationalUnit.children.
        Throws:
        BackendException - Propagates the exception from getOrganizationalUnits(UUID, boolean)

      • getOrganizationalUnits

        public java.util.List<OrganizationalUnit> getOrganizationalUnits(java.util.UUID userId,
                                                                 boolean flatten)
                                                          throws BackendException
        Returns a list of all currently existing OrganizationalUnits. This does not separate between top level organizational units (like BMW, Audi, etc.) and lower level organizational units (like BMW/Marketing, Audi/HR, etc.). The method can flatten the result to have every OrganizationalUnit directly available in the list if instructed to do so via the second parameter
        Parameters:
        userId - The user requesting the OrganizationalUnits
        flatten - Decides whether to flatten the hierarchical structure of OrganizationalUnit and their OrganizationalUnit.children
        Returns:
        A list of all currently existing organizational units
        Throws:
        BackendException - If the REST-call failed

      • flattenOus

        private java.util.List<OrganizationalUnit> flattenOus(java.util.List<OrganizationalUnit> units)
        Flattens a List of OrganizationalUnits since an OrganizationalUnit can contain children. The backend does not return a flat version of the OrganizationalUnits but rather a nested one where every child needs to be accessed via OrganizationalUnit.getChildren() of their respective parent.
        Parameters:
        units - The list of OrganizationalUnits to flatten
        Returns:
        A flat version of the given input where every child is accessible in the list directly and does not need to be searched via its parents OrganizationalUnit.children field.

      • getOuSettings

        public OrganizationalUnitSettings getOuSettings(java.util.UUID ouId,
                                                java.util.UUID userId)
                                         throws BackendException
        Returns an organizational units settings
        Parameters:
        ouId - The id of the OrganizationalUnit for which the OrganizationalUnitSettingsare requested
        userId - The id of the user requesting the settings
        Returns:
        The settings of the specified organizational unit or null if the unit does not exist
        Throws:
        BackendException - If the REST-call failed or no OrganizationalUnitSettings were found for the supplied id

      • updateOrganizationalUnitSettings

        public void updateOrganizationalUnitSettings(java.util.UUID userId,
                                             OrganizationalUnitSettings settings)
                                      throws BackendException
        Updates the settings of an OrganizationalUnit. The unit and its settings may not be linked in the classes in the frontend but are so in the backend
        Parameters:
        userId - The user performing the update
        settings - The updated version of already existing OrganizationalUnitSettings . Existing OrganizationalUnitSettings have a UserSettings.id that is not null
        Throws:
        BackendException - If the REST-call failed or the backend signals failure via a MethodResult with a MethodResult.state of SuccessState.Timeout or SuccessState.UnknownError

      • getPrincipalUnitsMinimalInformation

        public java.util.List<Tuple<java.util.UUID,java.lang.String>> getPrincipalUnitsMinimalInformation()
                                                                                           throws BackendException
        Returns a list of all principalunits. Those are childs of the root OrganizationalUnit SYSTEM. The information is minimal as it only returns the id and the name of those OrganizationalUnit. This is mostly used for security reasons. E.g. beans like OrganizationGuard use this to determine whether an organization actually exists. Though they only access this method indirectly via nameToUuidCache, or more specifically mapOuNameToOuUUID(String).
        Returns:
        A list of all toplevel organizations but only their UUID and name
        Throws:
        BackendException - If the REST-call failed

      • getPrincipalUnitsMinimalInformation

        private java.util.List<Tuple<java.util.UUID,java.lang.String>> getPrincipalUnitsMinimalInformation(boolean withSystem)
                                                                                            throws BackendException
        Returns a list of all principalunits. Those are childs of the root OrganizationalUnit SYSTEM. SYSTEM is also returned and needs to be filtered out. The information is minimal as it only returns the id and the name of those principalunits. This is mostly used for security reasons. E.g. beans like OrganizationGuard use this to determine whether an organization actually exists. Though they only access this method indirectly via nameToUuidCache, or more specifically mapOuNameToOuUUID(String).
        Parameters:
        withSystem - Whether to return the OrganizationalUnit "SYSTEM in the result list
        Returns:
        A list of all toplevel organizations but only their UUID and name
        Throws:
        BackendException - If the REST-call failed

      • getPrincipalUnits

        public java.util.List<OrganizationalUnit> getPrincipalUnits(java.util.UUID userId)
                                                     throws BackendException
        Returns a list of OrganizationalUnit that are childs of "SYSTEM". This means they are the root of a customer like Example Ltd. Compared to getPrincipalUnitsMinimalInformation() the returned Objects are actual instances of OrganizationalUnit and not just a Tuple of their id and name.
        Parameters:
        userId - The user requesting
        Returns:
        A list of all principal units
        Throws:
        BackendException - If the REST-call failed. This might be because the User belonging to the supplied id does not have sufficient rights

      • updateCache

        @Scheduled(fixedRate=120000L)
private void updateCache()
        Updates nameToUuidCache in a regular interval. The interval is between the begin of method execution. The old call to the method does not have to be completed before the next method call. The interval itself is a magic number and currently sits at 2 minutes.

      • mapOuNameToOuUUID

        public java.util.UUID mapOuNameToOuUUID(java.lang.String ouName)
        Determines the UUID corresponding to the supplied name. This allows for using a HashMap as a cache since it might be useful.
        Parameters:
        ouName - The name for which the UUID should be found
        Returns:
        The UUID corresponding to the supplied name. Might be null if the name does not exist or the cache was not updated fast enough.

      • getUnitChildren

        public java.util.List<Tuple<java.util.UUID,java.lang.String>> getUnitChildren(java.util.UUID unitId)
                                                                       throws BackendException
        Gets the children of the supplied unit
        Parameters:
        unitId - The id of the OrganizationalUnit for which the children should be found
        Returns:
        A list of Tuple with the children's id and name
        Throws:
        BackendException - If the REST-call failed

      • getUnitChildren

        public java.util.List<Tuple<java.util.UUID,java.lang.String>> getUnitChildren(java.lang.String organization)
                                                                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                              BackendException
        Overloaded version of getUnitChildren(UUID). It maps the supplied organization name to its id
        Parameters:
        organization - The name of the OrganizationalUnit for which the children should be found
        Returns:
        A list of Tuple with the children's id and name
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the organization's name could not be mapped to an id
        BackendException - If the call to getUnitChildren(UUID) throws it. This signals a REST-Call gone wrong

      • addOrganizationalUnit

        public void addOrganizationalUnit(java.util.UUID userId,
                                  java.util.UUID parentOuId,
                                  java.lang.String name)
                           throws BackendException
        Adds a normal unit with the supplied name to the supplied parent. addPrincipalUnit(UUID, String, String) adds an OrganizationalUnit as a customer root to Jack the Clipper
        Parameters:
        userId - The user adding the unit
        parentOuId - The parent of the unit that should be created. E.g. the new unit should inherit this OrganizationalUnit's OrganizationalUnitSettings.
        name - The name of the created unit
        Throws:
        BackendException - If the REST-call failed or the backend signals failure via a MethodResult with a MethodResult.state of SuccessState.Timeout or SuccessState.UnknownError

      • deleteOrganizationalUnit

        public void deleteOrganizationalUnit(java.util.UUID userId,
                                     java.util.UUID unitId)
                              throws BackendException
        Deletes the specified OrganizationalUnit
        Parameters:
        userId - The user requesting the deletion
        unitId - The id of the unit that should be deleted
        Throws:
        BackendException - If the deletion failed

      • updateOrganizationalUnit

        public void updateOrganizationalUnit(java.util.UUID userId,
                                     OrganizationalUnit unit)
                              throws BackendException
        Updates an already existing OrganizationalUnit at the backend
        Parameters:
        userId - The id of user updating the unit
        unit - The updated version of an already existing OrganizationalUnit. You can see that a unit does exist by checking if OrganizationalUnit.getId() returns null
        Throws:
        BackendException - If the REST-call failed or the backend signals failure via a MethodResult with a MethodResult.state of SuccessState.Timeout or SuccessState.UnknownError

      • addPrincipalUnit

        public void addPrincipalUnit(java.util.UUID userId,
                             java.lang.String name,
                             java.lang.String principalMail)
                      throws BackendException
        Adds a new OrganizationalUnit but compared to addOrganizationalUnit(UUID, UUID, String) this one has the "SYSTEM unit as its parent ou. The new OrganizationalUnits is thus a customer of Jack the Clipper. Furthermore a default user with UserRole.StaffChief is created for the unit with the supplied principalMail as mail address
        Parameters:
        userId - The id of the user adding this new principal unit
        name - The name of the new principalunit
        principalMail - The email of the default user that is created for this new principalunit
        Throws:
        BackendException - If the REST-call failed or the backend signals failure via a MethodResult with a MethodResult.state of SuccessState.Timeout or SuccessState.UnknownError
